div.p: You explain the unfortunate business of the French; however, I wrote before, which I now repeat: if you have done your best and cannot proceed further, then let it rest. What you have not sent to me, I do not ask from ours for reasons previously explained to you; therefore, further communications are welcome to him.
It is difficult to advise a cause that is handled by shape-shifters and hypocrites... The matter displeases me so much that it cannot displease me more.
I wish he had died before writing those blasphemous dialogues, which I believe were composed with the conspiracy of Laelius, Castellio, and the other monsters. Zurich, April 20, 1565.
